faqs.question: How do I ask LENA about assignment dates?
faqs.answer: Ask natural questions like “When is Assignment 1 due?” and LENA will cite the schedule.

faqs.question: Where can I find office hours and contact info?
faqs.answer: Office hours and email are listed in the syllabus and weekly announcements.

faqs.question: What is the late work policy?
faqs.answer: Late submissions incur the penalty noted in the syllabus; request extensions before deadlines.

faqs.question: How do I submit assignments?
faqs.answer: Upload PDFs to the LMS Assignments page unless otherwise noted.

faqs.question: Can I resubmit homework?
faqs.answer: Resubmissions are allowed only if enabled per assignment; check the assignment description.

faqs.question: How is participation graded?
faqs.answer: Weekly participation is based on discussions and in-class engagement per the grading section.

faqs.question: How do I cite course readings?
faqs.answer: Use the required style (APA). Include author, year, and page for quotes.

faqs.question: Where are lecture slides posted?
faqs.answer: Slides are posted to the LMS within 24 hours of each class.

faqs.question: Who do I contact for accommodations?
faqs.answer: Contact the accessibility office and copy the instructor with your letter.

faqs.question: Can I collaborate on homework?
faqs.answer: Follow the collaboration rules in the syllabus; ask when unsure.

faqs.question: How do I reach the TA?
faqs.answer: TA email and office hours are on the syllabus and LMS staff page.

faqs.question: What goes in field notes?
faqs.answer: Separate observation from interpretation, include timestamps, keep entries concise.

faqs.question: How are grades curved?
faqs.answer: Grades are not curved by default; any adjustments will be announced.

faqs.question: Where is the reading list?
faqs.answer: All required and optional readings are in LMS modules by week.

faqs.question: How do I prepare for the exam?
faqs.answer: Review lecture summaries, key terms, and practice questions in the study guide.

How to study for the exam?
